profile_positions.description:
The Client Services & Procurement Specialist is a procurement and order fulfilment expert for assigned countries within the Client Services unit.
He/she utilizes the technical expertise of suppliers for various pharmaceutical and non-pharmaceutical products.
The Specialist is responsible for managing the smooth process of purchasing or ordering quality assured healthcare products. The Specialist must ensure compliance with company, funder and/or customer requirements and must define corrective actions in cases where objectives cannot be met. He/she must define corrective actions in case of irregularities.
Client Services & Procurement Specialist is responsible for managing the successful implementation of daily ordering and procurement operations.
The Specialist is the point of contact for funders/clients and suppliers for order related communications.The Specialist must provide excellent customer service to all stakeholders. The Specialist is responsible for providing regular updates on the status of orders and responding to customer questions, concerns and issues.
The Client Services & Procurement Specialist is also responsible for maintaining accuracy from inquiry to purchase order confirmation.
The Client Services & Procurement Specialist is also responsible for maintaining the accuracy of data from requisition to purchase order confirmation and working with the logistics unit to ensure that procurement is set up and executed in accordance with company and funder/client KPI's.
profile_positions.title: Client Services & Procurement Specialist

profile_positions.description:
- Work closely with the Director of Operations to ensure that all operational departments work in accordance with programs to facilitate smooth, efficient and effective implementation.
- Ensure that weekly coordination meetings between each program and operations take place.
- Work closely with and supervise Heads of Office to ensure that supporting systems and structures are in place and in compliance with relevant internal and external policies and procedures.
profile_positions.title: Operation Manager

profile_positions.location: Democratic Republic of the Congo Goma
profile_positions.description:
FLEET MANAGEMENT
- Oversee the fleet management team and ensure systems are in place to track maintenance schedules, fuel usage, and vehicle schedules as outlined in the field fleet management guidelines. 
- Oversees repairs, to ensure a functional fleet and value for money for the organization.
- Ensures smooth fleet shipping 

STOCK & ASSET MANAGEMENT
-Oversees the receipt of goods as described in the purchase order/request. Inspects merchandise upon delivery and rejects unsuitable, broken, substandard, and other items not meeting order requirements-
-Ensures compliance with MC procedures in inventory and asset management.Gathers and reviews data and prepares report on monthly inventory, end of grant inventory, fiscal year physical counts, and other physical counts as directed by supervisor. 
- Communicate with program managers on distribution plans and organize all required documentation
 - Contribute to the country strategic planning process and provide regular updates
- Maintain inventory records of materials and material flows in all offices Organize the transfer and disposition of assets according to donor rules and regulations

 MANAGEMENT ITC 

- Ensure that all relevant staff have access to the appropriate training and education materials. 
- Ensure that all relevant staff have a properly functioning computer 
- Ensure that the Internet connection is sufficient for our needs Analyze and suggest improvements to the quality of the internal network Work with the team to improve and update systems and software in accordance with Mercy Corps ITC procedures Plan the renewal of materials
profile_positions.title: logistics coordinator

profile_positions.description:
RESPONSIBILITIES 

The Field Coordinator is responsible for the smooth running of the base and the implementation of the programs developed on this base, managing in particular the security and the management of the teams. 

PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES 

Security: responsible for security on the base and when the team travels in the field. 

Programs : coordinates the teams and ensures the proper implementation of programs on his/her base, under the supervision of his/her direct supervisor. 

Human Resources: supervises all teams in the base, national and international staff.

 Logistical, administrative and financial monitoring: supervises the logistical, administrative and financial aspects of program implementation at the base, and ensures compliance with related procedures, with the functional support of the logistician and the mission administrator. 

Representation: represents the association with partners, authorities and various local actors involved in the intervention area of his/her base. 

Coordination: centralizes and disseminates information from/to his/her base and consolidates the internal and external reporting of activities implemented in his/her intervention zone before transmitting it to his/her direct supervisor. 

Evaluation / Strategy: participates in the development of strategy and proposes new interventions according to the needs identified in his/her intervention area.
profile_positions.title: Field Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
ENSURE THE LOGISTIC FOLLOW-UP OF THE BASE
- Ensures the daily management of the logistic staff under its hierarchical responsibility, 
- Ensures training in the organization's logistics procedures and tools.
- Participates in the sizing of the mission's logistics team.
- Ensures the supply of the base (support and program) and addresses the needs 
- Supervises the motorized equipment fleet (vehicles and generators) and organizes the movement of vehicles 
- Ensures the proper tracking of goods and equipment.
- Ensures the delivery of program goods to the intervention sites (loading, transport, unloading)

ENSURE THE ADMINISTRATIVE AND FINANCIAL FOLLOW-UP OF THE BASE
- responsible for cost optimization
- Ensures that the accounting is done according to internal rules
- Monitors the cash flow of his base and supervises payments.
- Ensures that the cash and bank balances are always fully justified by the appropriate accounting documents.

ENSURE THE ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT OF HUMAN RESOURCES ON THE BASE
- Participates in the recruitment process as well as in any decision to terminate an employment contract of national staff on his base.
- Ensures compliance with the PUI Internal Regulations at the base.
- Ensures the administrative management of national staff, in particular payroll operations and the follow-up of absences
- Completes the training of local staff (logistical and administrative aspects) if needed.
- Prepares the profiles of the national positions under his/her direct supervision
- She is the guarantor of PUI's image in his/her area of intervention and ensures that all personnel under her responsibility behave in accordance with the values defended by the organization and respect the local culture
profile_positions.title: Logistics/procurement Administrator

profile_positions.description:
Logistics Monitoring: Supervises the logistical aspects, in particular the monitoring of orders, stocks, fuel consumption, equipment and the organization of vehicle movements, the proper layout and operation of the bases with the functional support of the Logistics Coordinator of the mission.

Security Management: Under the supervision of the Field Coordinator, participates in security management in terms of information collection and transmission and ensures that the logistical means dedicated to security (buildings, vehicles, telecommunications) are adapted to the needs and functional.

Administrative and Financial Monitoring: oversees the administrative and financial aspects of the area and ensures compliance with related procedures, with the functional support of the Administrative and Financial Coordinator (AFC) of the mission.

Human Resources: Oversees the administrative management of human resources in the area

Organizational and strategic development/restructuring: makes concrete proposals in terms of organization, adaptation and restructuring of the bases and sub-bases in his/her zone/province in order to optimize costs and access to the intervention zones and ensures their effectiveness in the field (opening/closing of bases according to volume, reorganization of the Admin team, logistics and means, etc.)
profile_positions.title: Logistics administrator and procurement / field coordinator
